class SingletonServer

Detailed Description

Abstract class for singleton control.

This class implements the general utilites used to control the lifetime of a phoenix singleton. It is derived by SingeltonWrapper that is the class that really encapsulates the singleton instance. This class just provide an abstract entry point to ease the registering andf life-time control of the singletons.

Author:
Frederic Py <fpy@mbari.org>

SingletonDummy * SingletonDummy::attach ( std::string const &  name,
sdummy_factory const &  factory 
) [static, protected]

Singleton creation.

Parameters:
name singleton identifier
factory singleton creation functor

This method connect to the SingletonServer and looks for the existance of the wrapper to the key name if this one does not exist, it uses factory to create this neew entry in the server.

Postcondition:
A new singleton is attached to the identifier name
See also:
SingletonDummy *sdummy_factorycreate()

void SingletonDummy::detach ( std::string const &  name  )  [static, protected]

reference end notification

Parameters:
name singleton identifier

This methods notifies that the singleton name just lost one reference. If the count reach 0 this singleton is then destroyed from the SingletonServer
